title: tempest.api.compute.servers.test_servers.ServersTestJSON.test_create_with_existing_server_name fail in gate with BuildExceptionError

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~peter-a-portante

comments.content:
This is probably one of the many libvirt connection reset bugs that we already know about, from the nova scheduler logs:

2013-12-04 05:55:01.558 DEBUG nova.scheduler.filters.compute_filter [req-e44ab606-d67f-4209-aeea-9815fad7d1bf ServersTestJSON-tempest-1823657595-user ServersTestJSON-tempest-1823657595-tenant] (devstack-precise-hpcloud-az2-784812, devstack-precise-hpcloud-az2-784812) ram:7346 disk:208896 io_ops:0 instances:2 is disabled or has not been heard from in a while host_passes /opt/stack/new/nova/nova/scheduler/filters/compute_filter.py:44
2013-12-04 05:55:01.559 INFO nova.filters [req-e44ab606-d67f-4209-aeea-9815fad7d1bf ServersTestJSON-tempest-1823657595-user ServersTestJSON-tempest-1823657595-tenant] Filter ComputeFilter returned 0 hosts
2013-12-04 05:55:01.559 WARNING nova.scheduler.driver [req-e44ab606-d67f-4209-aeea-9815fad7d1bf ServersTestJSON-tempest-1823657595-user ServersTestJSON-tempest-1823657595-tenant] [instance: 2fe91f2b-4be0-4890-9696-7f43f8423a24] Setting instance to ERROR state.

Seeing this in the n-cpu logs:

libvirtError: Unable to write to monitor: Broken pipe

However, there is a high success rate in builds when that error shows up, so probably not the root cause.
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content:
Also queried logstash on this but it has more successes than fails so not a good fingerprint:

message:"libvirtError: Domain not found: no domain with matching uuid" AND filename:"logs/screen-n-cpu.txt"
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~mriedem

comments.content: doesn't seem very schedule like right now
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~johngarbutt

comments.content: this looks likes a libvirt error (we already have several open bugs for this).
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~jogo
